rewards.Hard: Shards Basic x15, Worf x5, Latinum x590

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hu'tegh! This atmosphere burns hotter than the fire caverns of Boreth!
I’ll take your word for it. The ship’s picking up a long-range mayday transmission… Federation by the sound of it.
Look over there, towards those hills… There’s some sort of device half-buried in the sand. Could it be coming from that?
No, but scans show massive amounts of energy contained inside that thing; enough to knock a starship out of orbit!
Should we investigate?

You’ll pay for this treachery with your lives!

They’re heading straight for the mayday signal.
There’s a smaller set of footprints heading off to the side, around the dune. It might be a shortcut!

It is a runabout from Deep Space Nine, Doctor, after your time.
Nobody’s here, but the debris fields stretches over the dunes.

The footprints lead directly through it.
Looks like a dust storm’s closing in. Better hurry, or we’ll be breathing sand!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There’s some form of encampment by those rocks.
Looks like a makeshift shelter, maybe Dukat’s?
This blasted sand covered his tracks!
Let’s investigate. There may still be something there we can use to find him.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Will your kind never learn?! I will not be caged!
Stand down, Dukat! We have you outnumbered.
You think I face you alone? The gods are on my side.
Odo was a fool to think this is some mere trinket.
This is a BLACK DURANJA: a vessel fashioned to contain the power of the PAH WRAITHS!
AGGHHHHHHHHH!

first_reward.Easy: Latinum x60, Player XP x60, Shards Basic x6, Antiproton x15
first_reward.Hard: Latinum x240, Player XP x240, Shards Basic x6, Trellium-D x45

missions.locDescription: In the ruins of a prison transport, the away team find that Gul Dukat has escaped capitivity.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode3_Mission3

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Just when I was glad to be rid of the Cardassians…
Walk away! This is our territory now. Your kind is not welcome here.
Bah! On whose orders do you claim this planet?
Our own! Any treasure buried in these sands is ours!
Mercenaries! The lowest form of honor-less dogs.
Hah! I'd be insulted if this wasn’t coming from a Klingon lackey of the Federation!

first_reward.Easy: Latinum x65, Player XP x65, Shards Basic x6, Trellium-D x15
first_reward.Hard: Latinum x245, Player XP x245, Shards Basic x6, Xenylon x45
first_reward.Doom: Latinum x425, Player XP x425, Shards Basic x6, Power Cell x15

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So, this friend of yours - Odo - any idea where he would have gone?
He would have first sought shelter from the storms.
Well, I can't match Vulcans when it comes to logic, but…
…the shuttle crashed in a valley with only two obvious exits. We know Dukat went one way. My best guess is Odo went the other.

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: If left alone they might ambush us at any point. Best to deal with them now!

first_reward.Doom: Latinum x425, Player XP x425, Shards Basic x6, Trellium-D x105

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stop! It's another one of the alien devices.
This one is more active than the other. Scans reveal heavier shielding, and energy pulsing out across nearby rocks.
We should steer clear of it. Finding Odo is our priority.
Let’s look for a path around it.
I’d say that’s a door built to keep people out. Or to keep something in.
Yes, and its architecture and patterns are similar to those other devices we’ve come across.
It seems to be shut tight. I don’t see a way Odo could have gotten inside.
Odo’s form is somewhat... fluid. He’s able to change it in order to get through tight spaces.
Sounds like Starfleet’s now recruiting all kinds of interesting folks.
Well, if nobody’s got the key, how do we open this thing?

first_reward.Hard: Player XP x185
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x320

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x100
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x370
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x640

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: Perhaps we can use our tricorders to locate the locking mechanism and disrupt it?
exploration.locResultDescLoc: The away team successfully hacked the strange device, disabling it. Feeling hopeful, the team receives a Morale Boost.

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x50
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x185
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x320

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: It might be possible to destroy the rock around the door with our phasers, so that we might pass through.
exploration.locResultDescLoc: Using their phasers the away team is able to create a small gap in the rock around the door and squeeze inside.

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x50
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x185
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x320

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: Interesting! Scans show there's an immense structure hidden behind it.
exploration.locResultDescLoc: Scans reveal a large, underground, structure teeming with energy. Prepared for combat, the away team pushes forward receiving an Attack Bonus.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Thank you for leading us inside, Federation fools!
You congratulate yourselves too soon!

missions.locDescription: Prisoner secure, the away team hunt for the shuttle's pilot - Odo.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode3_Mission4

rewards.Easy: Shards Basic x10, Duranium x15, Latinum x175

rewards.Doom: Shards Basic x20, Andorian Silk x57, Latinum x1080

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Resist...
...futile...
Ahead of us – a Borg drone!
A… Borg? Like a cyborg?
No. The Borg are a predatory race of organic life forms assimilated into a collective hivemind. They are the greatest threat the Federation has ever faced!
Exizztenz...
...iz -  iz -  izzz over…
Well, when you put it that way…

first_reward.Easy: Latinum x70, Player XP x70, Shards Basic x6, Antiproton x15
first_reward.Hard: Latinum x250, Player XP x250, Shards Basic x6, Trellium-D x45
first_reward.Doom: Latinum x430, Player XP x430, Shards Basic x6, Antiproton x105

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Careful! There's some sort of flooding here.
Scans show high amounts of dimethyl cadmium, hexavalent chromium and a mix of other toxic ingredients.
Not a cocktail you want to drink.
Time is short. We can simply wade across.
I can give you a hypospray to prepare you, but don’t blame me for the hangover.

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x55
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x190
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x325

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x55
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x190
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x325

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: Ugh... I feel nauseous…
exploration.locResultDescLoc: The away team pushes forward through the waste, placing them deeper in the structure. Footprints trailing away from the waste indicate that the away team is not alone.

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x55
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x190
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x325

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: Let’s look for another way around.
exploration.locResultDescLoc: The away team pulls back in an attempt to avoid the hazardous waste spill. The away team has discovered an alternate path.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Up ahead! Are those… Starfleet crew?
What are the odds that Starfleet officers are just hanging around an abandoned alien facility?
Look at their eyes! I’ve not known eyes that glow like that.
They’ve spotted us. And they don’t look friendly!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Borg! Hundreds of them!
They seem... dormant?
It could be that they all shut down when the lights went out in here.
Let's investigate.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: It’s another one of those devices we saw outside.
Do you hear that humming? I think it’s powering up!
If it is indeed a Borg creation, we must try to shut it down.
Easier said than done. It’s heavily shielded.
Looks like the locals are waking up!

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: Just give me a moment, I think I can override it…
exploration.locResultDescLoc: The Borg systems have detected the hacking intrusion and has alerted nearby Borg drones.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there! That door must be important. It's heavily guarded.
We are...the B-B-Borg.
You will be...
....be... assimilated.
RESISTANCE IS…
FUTILE!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Worf! Over here!
Odo!
You’re that last face I expected to see. But a welcome one!
The Borg have kept in this shielded room for days.
Do you have any idea what they're up to?
They attempted to assimilate me, fortunately with no success.
Now the Borg seem interested in my ability to shapeshift. I’ve been prodded and poked more times than I care to count.
We can try to overload the shields with short phaser bursts.
That might draw unwelcome attention. I can try to hack it.

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x60
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x195
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x330

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x115
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x385
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x655

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: There! That did it!
exploration.locResultDescLoc: The away team disables the shield and frees Odo.

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x60

first_reward.Doom: Player XP x330

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: Hurry, Odo!
exploration.locResultDescLoc: The away team overloads the shield with sustained fire from their phasers and frees Odo.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of the doppelgangers!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Primary Objective: Protect pool from intruders.
Secondary protocol: Assimilation.
What “pool” are they talking about?

first_reward.Easy: Latinum x75, Player XP x75, Shards Basic x6, Antiproton x15
first_reward.Hard: Latinum x255, Player XP x255, Shards Basic x6, Trellium-D x45

first_reward.Hard: Latinum x385, Proto Command 01 x5, Duranium x17
first_reward.Doom: Latinum x655, Proto Command 01 x5, Duranium x35

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: That must be the pool the drone mentioned!
It’s Mimetic fluid… It’s able to sample DNA and produce clones of the original life-form.
This could allow the Borg to multiply indefinitely, faster than by assimilating other species!
None of the doppelgangers we’ve encountered seem to be Borg, though. That means they have yet to successfully utilize the pool.
So where did they get the DNA from?
Perhaps captives of the Borg? The pool might have sampled their DNA and is now spontaneously producing copies of them.
I have another suggestion. Look there, in the shadows above the pool.
Good eyes, Worf! It’s another of those Nexus Devices! It appears to be discharging energy into the pool.
We have to shut this down before the Borg are able to unlock the fluid’s full potential!

first_reward.Hard: Player XP x385
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x655

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x60

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: I concur. Phasers on full!
exploration.locResultDescLoc: The away team fires their phasers collapsing the room onto the pool.

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x115
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x385
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x655

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: If this fluid is what you say it is, we should at least retrieve a sample.
exploration.locResultDescLoc: The away team gathers a sample of the fluid in the pool.

first_reward.Easy: Player XP x115
first_reward.Hard: Player XP x385
first_reward.Doom: Player XP x655

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: If this fluid can replicate life, that suggests it could be organic. Perhaps even sentient…
exploration.locResultDescLoc: The away team establishes a link with the fluid. It's confused, frightened... and angry.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Mimetic life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Something’s emerging from the pool!
It looks like… Odo?
But I never came into contact with the fluid.
Well, it doesn’t look like it wants a friendly chat.
Defend yourselves!

missions.locDescription: In the heart of the Borg outpost the team encounters a mimetic pool, capable of imitating any lifeform.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode3_Mission6

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Resistance is futile!
There's more Borg ahead!
You will be assimilated.
More drones are waking up!
Not just the Borg. The entire complex is coming online!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: If they have the power to blast starships out of the sky, the Artemis is a sitting duck right now!
We must shut off the power once and for all!
Those nodes we encountered earlier must regulate the complex’s power grid.
If that's the case, we may be able to disrupt several of them, alter the flow and divert power away from the main system.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There! A power node.
Scans indicate this is the only node still active and powering the complex.
If we can destroy it, it will cut off the power across the facility, lowering and shields and preventing the drones from recharging.
The less we talk, the sooner this nightmare is over!

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: That node there must be the Borg’s local communication array.
